shortBio: Chef Fatema Yasmin is a renowned Bangladeshi chef known for her expertise in traditional Bengali cuisine. She has authored several cookbooks and has won numerous culinary awards.

recipes.cookingMethod: Marinate the fish with salt and turmeric. In a pan, heat mustard oil and add mustard paste and green chilies. Add the marinated fish and cook until done. Serve hot with steamed rice.

Marinate the prawns with salt and mustard paste. In a bowl, mix coconut milk, mustard paste, green chilies, salt, and sugar. Add the marinated prawns and steam for 10 minutes. Serve hot with steamed rice.

Wash rice and lentils and soak for 30 minutes. In a pan, heat ghee and add sliced onions, garlic, and ginger. Add cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric, and garam masala. Add chopped potatoes and cook until soft. Add the soaked rice and lentils and mix well. Add water and salt and cook until done. Serve hot.

shortBio: Chef Abdul Karim is a popular Bangladeshi chef known for his innovative fusion cuisine. He has appeared on several cooking shows and has a strong social media following.

recipes.cookingMethod: Marinate the fish with salt and turmeric. Fry the fish until golden brown. In a separate pan, heat mustard oil and add mustard paste, turmeric, salt, and green chilies. Add water and cook until the mixture thickens. Add the fried fish and cook for a few minutes. Serve hot with steamed rice.

recipes.recipeName: Chingri Macher Malai Curry (Prawn Curry with Coconut Milk)
recipes.cookingMethod: In a pan, heat oil and add sliced onions, ginger, and garlic. Add cumin powder and cook until the onions are soft. Add prawns and cook for a few minutes. Add coconut milk and cook until the mixture thickens. Serve hot with steamed rice.

recipes.recipeName: Bhuna Khichuri (Spicy Lentil and Rice Dish)
recipes.cookingMethod: Soak rice and lentils separately. In a pan, heat oil and add sliced onions, ginger, and garlic. Add cumin powder, coriander powder, and turmeric. Add the soaked rice and lentils and mix well. Add water and green chilies. Cook until the water is absorbed and the rice and lentils are cooked. Serve hot with fried onions and papad.

shortBio: Chef Nazia Sultana is a Bangladeshi chef with a passion for healthy cooking. She focuses on using locally sourced, organic ingredients in her dishes and is a strong advocate for sustainable farming practices.

recipes.cookingMethod: In a pan, heat ghee and add sliced onions, garlic, and ginger. Add cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric, and chili powder. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until soft. Add chopped okra and salt and cook until done. Serve hot with roti or rice.

Soak the dal for 30 minutes. In a pressure cooker, heat oil and add cumin seeds. Add sliced onions, garlic, and ginger. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until soft. Add the soaked dal, turmeric, garam masala, and salt. Add water and pressure cook for 3-4 whistles. Add chopped kale leaves and cook for another 5 minutes. Serve hot with rice or roti.

Boil and mash the potatoes and beetroot. In a pan, heat oil and add chopped green chilies, ginger, and garlic. Add garam masala, turmeric, and salt. Add the mashed vegetables and mix well. Make small cutlets and coat with bread crumbs. Fry in hot oil until golden brown. Serve hot with chutney.

shortBio: Chef Mushfiqur Rahman is a highly skilled Bangladeshi chef with over 15 years of experience in the culinary industry. He specializes in creating unique, high-end dishes that showcase the best of Bangladeshi cuisine.

recipes.cookingMethod: Mix rice flour, sugar, and salt with water to make a dough. Divide the dough into small balls and flatten them. Add grated coconut and cardamom to the center of the flattened dough and fold it. Steam the pitha in a steamer for 10-15 minutes. Serve hot.

Roast eggplant and remove the skin. In a pan, heat mustard oil and add sliced onions, garlic, and green chilies. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until soft. Mash the roasted eggplant and mix with the onion-tomato mixture. Add salt to taste. Serve with rice.

Marinate chicken with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, and salt for 30 minutes. In a pan, heat ghee and add sliced onions, bay leaves, cinnamon, cardamom, and cloves. Add marinated chicken and cook until done. Boil basmati rice with salt and whole spices until half done. Layer the cooked chicken over the rice and sprinkle with saffron. Cover and cook on low heat until the rice is fully cooked. Serve hot.

shortBio: Chef Nazrul Islam is a seasoned Bangladeshi chef with over 12 years of experience in the culinary industry. He is known for his traditional approach to Bangladeshi cooking and his ability to create dishes that are both flavorful and comforting.

recipes.cookingMethod: In a pan, heat mustard oil and add sliced onions, bay leaves, cinnamon, cardamom, and cloves. Add ginger-garlic paste and green chilies and cook until fragrant. Add turmeric powder and coconut milk and bring to a simmer. Add prawns and cook until done. Add salt to taste. Serve hot with rice.

In a pan, heat ghee and add sliced onions, bay leaves, cinnamon, cardamom, and cloves. Add ginger, garlic, and green chilies and cook until fragrant. Add cashews and poppy seeds and cook until lightly toasted. Add mutton and cook until browned. Add yogurt and salt to taste. Cover and cook until the mutton is tender. Serve hot with naan or paratha.

Cut eggplant into thin slices and sprinkle with salt. Let sit for 10 minutes. In a bowl, mix turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, and cumin powder with water to make a paste. Coat the eggplant slices with the spice paste. Heat vegetable oil in a pan and fry the eggplant slices until golden brown. Serve hot as a side dish.

shortBio: Chef Farzana Akter is a rising star in the Bangladeshi culinary scene. With a background in nutrition, she creates dishes that are both delicious and healthy. Her focus is on using fresh, local ingredients and traditional cooking techniques to bring out the best flavors in her dishes.

recipes.cookingMethod: In a pan, heat mustard oil and add sliced onions, green chilies, and cubed potatoes. Cook until the potatoes are lightly browned. Add turmeric powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, and salt to taste. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until soft. Add chopped Pui Shak and cook until wilted. Serve hot with rice.

In a pan, heat mustard oil and add mustard paste, turmeric powder, and green chilies. Cook until the mustard paste is lightly toasted. Add the Hilsa fish and cook until done. Add salt to taste. Serve hot with steamed rice.

In a bowl, mix rice flour, grated coconut, jaggery, crushed cardamom, and salt. Add enough water to make a smooth batter. Pour the batter into a greased pan and steam for 20-25 minutes, or until cooked through. Serve hot or at room temperature.
